data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A small open container, usually with a flat bottom and a handle, used for drinking.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Such a container and its contents.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A unit of capacity or volume equal to 16 tablespoons or 8 fluid ounces (237 milliliters).
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The bowl of a drinking vessel.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The chalice or the wine used in the celebration of the Eucharist.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A decorative cup-shaped vessel awarded as a prize or trophy.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A golf hole or the metal container inside a hole.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Either of the two parts of a brassiere that fit over the breasts.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: An athletic supporter having a protective reinforcement of rigid plastic or metal.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
